repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Decentralized Urban Capacity
            Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Decentralized Urban
            Capacity Building Project for Burkina Faso were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: linking
            capacity building and budget support processes to provide
            financing for local investment and enhance reforms requires
            strong selectivity in areas of intervention and a clear
            institutional framework for implementation. Mainstreaming
            project management responsibility in government entities
            with the support of a small coordination team may be a
            positive innovation, but requires consistent and rigorous
            implementation support. Readiness of activities,
            implementing stakeholders, and substantial Bank support in
            initial stages of implementation is critical for effective
            implementation projects with complex institutional
            arrangements. Advancing policy dialogue and reforms through
            combination of budget support and standalone operations can
            be effective in achieving reform gains. Designing and
            implementing a stand-alone capacity building project
            requires clear incentives, goals, and institutional
            frameworks. The application of technical assistance loans
            may be better justified and manageable in a short to medium
            term policy reform area with tangible and timely outputs.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Decentralized Urban Capacity
            Building Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Decentralized Urban Capacity Building Project for Burkina
            Faso is to strengthen the delivery of urban services at the
            municipal level with special emphasis on Ouagadougou,
            Bobo-Dioulasso, Koudougou, Banfora, Ouahigouya and Kaya. The
            restructuring consists of the following: amendment of the
            financing agreement to include a new category of
            expenditure; and reallocation of the project proceeds among
            the categories of expenditures as specified in annex one.
            This is the second amendment to the financing agreement.
